TextBlock.Text: NESIA: I believe this cave should prove to be an adequate location for any equipment we might use to study the signal of the <color=orange>Eye</color>. In particular, the upper chamber across the ceiling looks well insulated. With some environmental regulation, the overheating of our equipment should be a non-issue.
AZOLLA: A good find, Nesia, but how do you propose we get up there? The gas in this cave prohibits the use of our thrusters.

NESIA: I believe gravity crystals constructed from the material of <color=orange>Graviton's Folly</color> should be useful. We could make specialized mounts to place the crystals in, amplifying their effect to the level we would need.

SENNETTI: In my experience, the collection and application of that material will be time-consuming, and there may be other portions of the ceiling that are worth exploring. I propose these mounts should allow for the removal and replacement of these crystals. Then we may explore more while additional crystals are fabricated.

AZOLLA: Good idea, both of you. A series of removable gravity crystals would allow us to explore the full area while resources are relatively low. We should begin construction of this system immediately.
